name: Status Code Confusion
description:
A page not found returns status 500 instead of the correct code.

Task: What status code means 'Not Found'?
code:
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error

The requested page does not exist.
hints: 500 means server error, not client error

name: Wrong HTTP Method
description:
A form submission uses GET instead of POST.

Task: What method should be used for data submission?
hints: GET is for retrieving data, not sending

name: Missing Content-Type
description:
Server can't parse JSON because Content-Type header is missing.

Task: What header specifies JSON data?
hints: Content-Type tells server the data format

name: Unauthorized Access
description:
API returns 401 but should return 403.

Task: What status code means 'Forbidden' (authenticated but not allowed)?
code:
HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized

You don't have permission to access this resource.

name: Cache Control
description:
Static assets are being re-downloaded on every request.

Task: What header controls browser caching?
hints: Caching reduces bandwidth and improves speed

name: Cookie vs Session
description:
Sensitive data is stored in cookies (insecure).

Task: Where should sensitive session data be stored?
hints: Store sensitive data server-side in sessions

name: CORS Error
description:
Browser blocks API request due to CORS policy.

Task: What header allows cross-origin requests?
code:
// Frontend: fetch('https://api.example.com/data')
// Error: CORS policy blocks request
hints: CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) is a security feature

name: Redirect Loop
description:
Page A redirects to Page B, which redirects back to Page A.

Task: What status code indicates a redirect?

name: REST Method Mismatch
description:
Deleting a resource uses POST instead of proper REST method.

Task: What HTTP method should delete a resource?

name: API Versioning
description:
Breaking API changes affect all clients.

Task: Where should version info go in the URL?
hints: Version APIs to maintain backwards compatibility

name: Request Timeout
description:
Long-running request hangs indefinitely.

Task: What HTTP header sets maximum wait time?
hints: Clients should set timeout to avoid hanging
Server can use Keep-Alive header for timeout hints

name: Content Encoding
description:
Large responses aren't compressed, wasting bandwidth.

Task: What encoding compresses HTTP responses?

name: Rate Limiting
description:
API is being abused with too many requests.

Task: What status code indicates rate limit exceeded?
hints: Rate limiting protects APIs from abuse

name: ETag Caching
description:
Server sends full response even when client has cached version.

Task: What header identifies resource version?
hints: Client sends If-None-Match, server returns 304 if unchanged

name: Preflight Request
description:
CORS preflight request fails because OPTIONS method isn't handled.

Task: What HTTP method is used for CORS preflight?
code:
// Browser sends preflight before actual request
// Server doesn't handle it
hints: Browsers send OPTIONS request before certain CORS requests

name: Authentication Header
description:
API requires authentication but header format is wrong.

Task: What header sends authentication credentials?
hints: Standard header for auth is Authorization

name: Idempotency
description:
Multiple POST requests create duplicate resources.

Task: What method is idempotent for updates?
hints: PUT and PATCH are idempotent for updates

name: WebSocket Upgrade
description:
Trying to establish WebSocket but missing upgrade header.

Task: What header value requests protocol upgrade?
hints: WebSocket starts as HTTP then upgrades

name: Content Negotiation
description:
Client wants JSON but server returns XML.

Task: What request header specifies desired response format?
code:
GET /api/data HTTP/1.1

// Returns XML instead of JSON

name: HTTP/2 Push
description:
Page loads slowly despite HTTP/2 because server doesn't push resources.

Task: What HTTP/2 feature proactively sends resources?
code:
// HTML loads, then CSS/JS load sequentially
// Could be faster with HTTP/2
hints: HTTP/2 can push resources before client requests them
